text: Poa pratensis (smooth meadow-grass, common meadow grass, or Kentucky bluegrass) is a type of grass. It is a perennial species of the grass family Poaceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and northern Africa. It grows to tall. Poa pratensis makes a useful pasture plant. It is also used for making lawns in parks and gardens. Poa is Greek for fodder, which is food fed to livestock. The name "Kentucky bluegrass" came from its blue flower heads. What makes Kentucky's Bluegrass blue – New York Times – June 3, 1993 ==References== Category:Poaceae
title: Poa pratensis
